newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Central Australia still dry - Met Bureau.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Central Australia still dry - Met Bureau.

text.p: Rainfall deficiencies still existed in southern parts of Australia's Northern Territory, the Bureau of Meteorology said in a statement.

This was despite an active monsoon in northern Australia in January and significant rain over central Australia, with subsequent serious flooding over parts of northwest Australia and central Queensland, it said.
Rainfall deficiencies were still evident west of Alice Springs and across the border into Western Australia, it said.
Small regions of serious rainfall deficiency also persisted near Katherine, east of Alice Springs, and between Hughenden and Townsville in Queensland, it said.
The major farming enterprise in the region is cattle growing on semi-arid pastures.
